content.description: A nice little route just to the right of The Barnum Route. Start off the big block and move up to a ledge. Undercling and move out through a face and finish on a crack and some crimps.
content.location: Start on a big boulder. Just right of The Barnum Route and left of Shadows of Crowes

climbs.name: Yankee Doodle Dandy In A Gold Rolls Royce

content.description: Tricky bouldery start up a small bulge to access the gold rock.  Fun movement on great stone!
content.location: The left start of the rightmost route

content.description: Pull into undercling and throw down powerful moves on steep terrain.  Fun Moves
content.location: The farthest left route starting down in the Riverbed.

content.description: Tricky start, then head up and right for several clips to reach the arete.  Squeeze your way up this cool feature and wrestle with the last 5 feet.  Hint: stem!!!
content.location: On the taller wall to the right of Circus In My Pants.  This route trends right for almost 15 feet to an obvious arete.

content.description: Clip first bolt standing on boulder.  Boulder problem start, then fun climbing past 5 more  bolts.
Climb huecos up and left to pull onto a ledge stance, then go up and right to the anchor. Short but sweet.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: Located to the right of "Step Right This Way" just left of a boulder.

climbs.name: Lil Smokie Goes to the Circus

content.description: A short 3 bolt line that starts on the large boulder that separates the Circus Wall. The climb starts on large gym-like fakes and finishes on thin dark rock.  A lot of fun for a shorty.
content.location: Start on top of large boulder

content.description: Climb up the short vert section on big holds to the base of the roof.  Get the third clipped and launch into a powerful boulder problem culminating in an all out dyno to a good hold.  Run it out to the anchors.  A great thrill!
content.location: On The Erratic pillar 100 feet to the left of Circus In The Wind.

content.description: Fun laybacking, sweet positive holds and powerful movement all the way to the top.
content.protection: Well bolted, chains or rings at the top.
content.location: Find the big flake on the very left-hand side of the wall.

content.description: Start to the right on or near a small boulder, move up on hard to find holds to reach the slab and a face. Â Merge into Yankee Doodle and figure out the next sequence and then follow a broken crack system to the anchors.
content.location: Furthest right route and shares second half with Yankee Doodle

content.description: Short, stout, and pretty fun. Start off a small boulder and pull some easy moves past two bolts until the black bulge is reached. Clip the draw over the bulge and fire the strenuous and reachy crux. Navigate a sea of unobvious and mediocre pockets and dishes on vertical terrain past one more bolt to arrive at the anchor.
content.location: Between "Sucker Born Every Minute" and "The Barnum Route".

content.description: I climb for routes like this! Five stars! Awesome movement on pockets, sidepulls, crimps will make you grin from ear to ear!  A couple of thin moves lead to a sidepull flake near the top.  Get ready to rumble as the holds close down to a few crimps and knobs just before the chains.
content.location: On the left side of the main Circus Wall.  Just right of I Love the Big Top (5.9) and to the left of the 'Circus in my Pants'(12c).  Starts on the right facing obvious layback flake.

content.description: Do the tricky Step right this Way start then go left.  As soon as you hit the black streak it gets difficult with multiple 5.12 cruxes and some 5.11 edge crimping for good measure at the top.  Excellent movement with several options for each hard section, make this route tough to onsight.  As cliche as it may sound, the hardest route at the crag is usually the best.  No different here.
content.location: The route between Step Right This Way and Circus In The Wind.  Same start as Step Right This Way, but go left after the second clip.

content.description: This is a short, but powerful route whose grade is mainly derived from the opening moves. Right off the deck you're greeted with an overhanging V4 boulder problem, which leads to a full rest.  Work through a second boulder problem over a buldge (easier than the first) until you reach some moderate low-angle climbing with decent holds that characterizes the remainder of the route.
content.protection: 6 bolts.  The anchor has two fixed biners.
content.location: To the right of Clowns Eat Kids. Some big huecos can be seen as the starting holds, which lead to a somewhat greasy diagonal rail.
